lines.text: Problem $1$ - Positional Indexes (5 points)
lines.text_display: \section{Problem $1$ - Positional Indexes (5 points)}

lines.text: Consider the following documents:
lines.text_display: Consider the following documents:

lines.text: Doc 1: I am a student, and I currently take CS276. I was a student in CS224N last quarter.
lines.text_display: Doc 1: I am a student, and I currently take CS276. I was a student in CS224N last quarter.

lines.text: Doc 2: I was a student. I have taken CS276.
lines.text_display: Doc 2: I was a student. I have taken CS276.

lines.text: a. We have seen that positional indexes are very useful to run queries and search against documents.
lines.text_display: a. We have seen that positional indexes are very useful to run queries and search against documents.

lines.text: Let's build positional indexes on top of these documents using the format $\mathrm{DocID}_{\mathrm{a}}$ : $<$ Position $_{\mathrm{abc}}$,
lines.text_display: Let's build positional indexes on top of these documents using the format $\mathrm{DocID}_{\mathrm{a}}$ : $<$ Position $_{\mathrm{abc}}$,

lines.text: Position $_{\mathrm{xyz}}>$; DocID $_{\mathrm{b}}$ : $<$ Position $_{\text {def }}$, Position $_{\text {ghi }}>; \ldots$
lines.text_display: Position $_{\mathrm{xyz}}>$; DocID $_{\mathrm{b}}$ : $<$ Position $_{\text {def }}$, Position $_{\text {ghi }}>; \ldots$

lines.text: The position of the first word in the document is $1$, by convention.
lines.text_display: The position of the first word in the document is $1$, by convention.

lines.text: For example, the positional index for the word "am" is as follows:
lines.text_display: For example, the positional index for the word "am" is as follows:

lines.text: Show the positional indexes for the words "I" and "CS276".
lines.text_display: Show the positional indexes for the words "I" and "CS276".

lines.text_display: b. A phrase query "word1 word2" retrieves the occurrences where word1 is immediately followed by

lines.text: word2. A / $k$ query "word1 $/ k$ word2" ( $k$ is a positive integer) retrieves the occurrences of word1

lines.text: Problem $2$ - Dictionary Storage Compression (10 points)
lines.text_display: \section{Problem $2$ - Dictionary Storage Compression (10 points)}
